contenido:
ASPCA Special Investigator Annemarie Lucas hugs goat found neglected in Brooklyn garage yesterday. Another goat was found dead at the property.

A Brooklyn homeowner got the goat of humane officers when he tried to turn his garage into a barnyard, authorities said yesterday. Agents responded to a report of "two lambs" at an undisclosed address and discovered a dehydrated goat wandering inside a garage. Joseph Pentangelo, an ASPCA Special Agent, stated that nearby, they found a 4-foot-long crate containing three hens, two pigeons, and the remains of another goat and two more pigeons. They did not know why they had these animals; it was undetermined whether they were kept as food or pets. However, the fact that there were three dead animals present is certainly concerning.
